messages.title: Fighting for you and your family
messages.content: Campaigning against Tory cuts in funding of schools in Camberwell and Peckham.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Fight for our local NHS, schools, and all our public services.
Insist on more police officers on our streets and homes for local people.
Continue to help local people and community.
Strong voice for you in the House of Commons.
Support and work with London’s vibrant arts and cultural community.
Must never take NHS for granted, keep up with all healthcare needs.
Cuts have led to fewer teachers and increased class sizes.
Ensure police officers are maintained on streets.

issues.brexitEurope: I campaigned for the UK to stay in the EU.
issues.education: Fighting school cuts, cuts have led to fewer teachers and increased class sizes.
issues.health: Defending the NHS, must never take NHS for granted, keep up with all healthcare needs.
issues.lawCrime: Insist on more police officers on our streets.

leaflet.personalStatement: Over the 25 years I have been your MP, I have helped thousands of people solve their problems and have always stood up for local people, local prosperity and local public services.

politicalExperience.achievements: Helped thousands of people, brought forward laws and changes including the National Minimum Wage and Winter Fuel Allowance.

endorsements.endorsement: Urge you to vote for Harriet Harman on 8 June. Harriet has the strength and energy to be your local champion in Camberwell and Peckham and in London.

images.caption: Fighting for you and your family

examples: Over the 25 years I have been your MP...
Cuts have led to fewer teachers and increased class sizes.
Brought forward the National Minimum Wage, Winter Fuel Allowance.
I have helped thousands of people.
I am a strong voice for you in the House of Commons.
Campaigning against Tory cuts in funding of schools in Camberwell and Peckham
Insist on more police officers on our streets.
Here to help local people and community.
Cuts have led to fewer teachers and increased class sizes.
